title: Dow falls nearly 300 points on losses in shares of Cisco, JPMorgan Chase
text:
Dragged down by negative returns for shares of Cisco and JPMorgan Chase, the Dow Jones Industrial Average is in selloff mode Tuesday morning. Shares of Cisco CSCO, -2.22% and JPMorgan Chase JPM, -2.05% are contributing to the index's intraday decline, as the Dow DJIA, -0.96% was most recently trading 298 points lower (-1.1%). Cisco's shares are down $1.08 (2.3%) while those of JPMorgan Chase are down $2.52 (2.2%), combining for a roughly 24-point drag on the Dow. Also contributing significantly to the decline are IBM IBM, -1.56%, Boeing BA, -1.82%, and Goldman Sachs GS, -1.53%. A $1 move in any one of the 30 components of the Dow equates to a 6.78-point swing.

Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights using data from Dow Jones and FactSet. See our market data terms of use.
